[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@rushstack/ts-command-line](./ts-command-line.md) &gt; [CommandLineParameterBase](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterbase.md)

## CommandLineParameterBase class

The base class for the various command-line parameter types.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare abstract class CommandLineParameterBase 
```

## Remarks

The constructor for this class is marked as internal. Third-party code should not call the constructor directly or create subclasses that extend the `CommandLineParameterBase` class.

## Properties

<table><thead><tr><th>

Property


</th><th>

Modifiers


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[allowNonStandardEnvironmentVariableNames](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterbase.allownonstandardenvironmentvariablenames.md)


</td><td>

`readonly`


</td><td>

boolean \| undefined


</td><td>

Allows for the use of environment variable names that do not conform to the standard described by the Shell and Utilities volume of IEEE Std 1003.1-2001. This disables the validation that is performed on the provided [IBaseCommandLineDefinition.environmentVariable](./ts-command-line.ibasecommandlinedefinition.environmentvariable.md) value by default.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[description](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterbase.description.md)


</td><td>

`readonly`


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

Documentation for the parameter that will be shown when invoking the tool with "--help"


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[environmentVariable](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterbase.environmentvariable.md)


</td><td>

`readonly`


</td><td>

string \| undefined


</td><td>

The name of an environment variable that the parameter value will be read from, if it was omitted from the command-line. An error will be reported if the environment value cannot be parsed.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[kind](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterbase.kind.md)


</td><td>

`abstract`

`readonly`


</td><td>

[CommandLineParameterKind](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterkind.md)


</td><td>

Indicates the type of parameter.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[longName](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterbase.longname.md)


</td><td>

`readonly`


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

The long name of the flag including double dashes, e.g. "--do-something"


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[parameterGroup](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterbase.parametergroup.md)


</td><td>

`readonly`


</td><td>

string \| typeof SCOPING\_PARAMETER\_GROUP \| undefined


</td><td>

An optional parameter group name, shown when invoking the tool with "--help"


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[parameterScope](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterbase.parameterscope.md)


</td><td>

`readonly`


</td><td>

string \| undefined


</td><td>

An optional parameter scope name, used to add a scope-prefixed parameter synonym, e.g. "--scope:do-something". Scopes provide additional flexibility for parameters in conflict resolution since when a scope is specified, parameters that have conflicting long names will be defined using only the scope-prefixed name.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[required](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterbase.required.md)


</td><td>

`readonly`


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

If true, then an error occurs if the parameter was not included on the command-line.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[scopedLongName](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterbase.scopedlongname.md)


</td><td>

`readonly`


</td><td>

string \| undefined


</td><td>

If a parameterScope is provided, returns the scope-prefixed long name of the flag, including double dashes, eg. "--scope:do-something". Otherwise undefined.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[shortName](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterbase.shortname.md)


</td><td>

`readonly`


</td><td>

string \| undefined


</td><td>

An optional short name for the flag including the dash, e.g. "-d"


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[undocumentedSynonyms](./ts-command-line.commandlineparameterbase.undocumentedsynonyms.md)


</td><td>

`readonly`


</td><td>

string\[\] \| undefined


</td><td>

Specifies additional names for this parameter that are accepted but not displayed in the command line help.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
